as latent heat, which is wasted in the atmosphere. The heating value of a fuel may, therefore, be
expressed as a gross value or a net value. The gross value includes all of the heat released from
the fuel, including any carried away in the water formed during combustion. The net value
excludes the latent heat of the water formed during combustion. It is important when obtaining
a calorific value to check whether it is net or gross. The differences between net and gross are
